titleInfo.title: United States Senate Joint Resolution 22 (115th Congress)
PROVIDING FOR CONSIDERATION OF H.R. 115, THIN BLUE LINE ACT

extension.searchTitle: PROVIDING FOR CONSIDERATION OF H.R. 115, THIN BLUE LINE ACT; Congressional Record Vol. 163, No. 85

congVote.result: So the previous question was ordered.
congVote.dailyDigestCategory1: Thin Blue Line Act_Rule for Consideration
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House agreed to H. Res. 323, providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 115) to amend title 18, United States Code, to provide additional aggravating factors for the imposition of the death penalty based on the status of the victim, by a recorded vote of 233 ayes to 184 noes, Roll No. 260, after the previous question was ordered by a yea-and-nay vote of 230 yeas to 189 nays, Roll No. 259.

congVote.result: So the resolution was agreed to.
congVote.dailyDigestCategory1: Thin Blue Line Act_Rule for Consideration
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House agreed to H. Res. 323, providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 115) to amend title 18, United States Code, to provide additional aggravating factors for the imposition of the death penalty based on the status of the victim, by a recorded vote of 233 ayes to 184 noes, Roll No. 260, after the previous question was ordered by a yea-and-nay vote of 230 yeas to 189 nays, Roll No. 259.

titleInfo.title: RAISING A QUESTION OF THE PRIVILEGES OF THE HOUSE

extension.searchTitle: RAISING A QUESTION OF THE PRIVILEGES OF THE HOUSE; Congressional Record Vol. 163, No. 85

congVote.result: So the motion was agreed to.
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: Representative Pascrell rose to a question of the privileges of the House and submitted a resolution. The Chair ruled that the resolution did not present a question of the privileges of the House. Subsequently, Representative Pascrell appealed the ruling of the chair and Representative Rothfus moved to table the appeal. Agreed to the motion to table the appeal of the ruling of the Chair by a yea-and-nay vote of 229 yeas to 188 nays with 1 answering ``present'', Roll No. 261.

titleInfo.title: REMOVING OUTDATED RESTRICTIONS TO ALLOW FOR JOB GROWTH ACT

extension.searchTitle: REMOVING OUTDATED RESTRICTIONS TO ALLOW FOR JOB GROWTH ACT; Congressional Record Vol. 163, No. 85

congVote.result: So (two-thirds being in the affirmative) the rules were suspended and the bill was passed.
congVote.dailyDigestCategory2: Removing Outdated Restrictions to Allow for Job Growth Act
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House agreed to suspend the rules and pass the following measures:<P/>H.R. 1177, to direct the Secretary of Agriculture to release on behalf of the United States the condition that certain lands conveyed to the City of Old Town, Maine, be used for a municipal airport, by a \2/3\ yea-and-nay vote of 418 yeas to 1 nay, Roll No. 262;
